author: tyuku57
title: the droids never stop!
review:
The new lego star wars video game is here! It is better than expected with only minor issues. Here is the review.

 

Firstly, the actual levels are superb with literally hundreds of battle droids attacking you in lego form! It contains all the new characters from the clone wars (apart from gree who I was dissapointed about.) The game also has many new features such as massive ground battles and new jedi abilities. I recomend this game to anybody.

 

Hope this review helps!

author: itsaturkey
title: The best Lego Hub to date
review:
HUB

The Hub is where you start. Lego has outdone themselves with the Clone Wars Hub. Because it is SO big, I'm going to break each room separately.

Clone Ship Bridge:
You start in the bridge of a Clone Ship (I forget the name) in front of you there is a mission control panel, where you can select what mission you want to do, I'll explain it later. There are a number of things you can do here, but most importantly you can take an elevator down to the main room.

Main Room/Engine room:
This room is massive, even more stuff you can smash here, including a purple stud.

Med Bay:
Here you can create a character of your own, although it has less options then the previous games, it still holds lots of fun.

MiniKit Room:
Unlike previous Lego games, when you collect minikits, they build a 'classic' Star Wars character. Each one is held in a blue container.

Prisoner Cell:
As you progress in the campaign, evil separatist appear in the ship's jail, they can be bought but it takes some time.

Gold Brick Hanger/Turret Room
In the middle of the room, a pile of gold bricks sits waiting to be built. 130 gold bricks must be earned before building. The Turret room is more of a recreation center. Here a ping-pong table and boxing dummy wait. you can also hop in one of the two turret's and blast away at enemy ships.

Hanger:
Two hangers hold both Mission selects and vehicle selects. One holds flying ships, the other holds vehicles such as AT-TE's
There is another Hub, but I'll let you discover that out for yourselves. I focused on the Hub because I feel that the Hub is one of the best parts of the game. The game style is a mix of Indy and the older star wars's. Characters you buy are now walking around waiting to be bought, and red bricks are hidden around the hubs. I hope i gave you some insight on the game.
